channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree branches pulling at telephone lines, 6th October
item.description:
Where the tree has grown the branches are now pulling at the telephone lines and has dislodged one from the front of a house.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beechcroft Avenue, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Abandoned car following hit & run, 6th October
item.description:
Car involved in a hit and run with a parked vehicle now abandoned in the middle of a residential street and causing an obstruction, this road is a thorough fare for other vehicles and is constantly busy especially during school times . Vehicle has severe damage and is not drivable. Police attended on Friday night and reported as there is no injuries to persons the local authority will need to remove it. Have made several attempts to contact Greenwich council via the switchboard on 06/10/25 and automated system continuously advises to call back later!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolacombe Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Westmoreland Rd - Litter and leaves, 6th October
item.description:
Along this section of Westmoreland Rd, either side of, and around bus stop and towards junction with South Hill Rd - pavement and fence-line needs thorough sweep to remove build up of litter and leaves please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115-119, Westmoreland Road, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of Rubbish, 6th October
item.description:
The area surrounding 1 Anerley Hill is full of rubbish both within the property boundaries and outside of it. The public bin is regularly surrounded by household rubbish as well as the trees in the area. This is attracting rats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
